# Corporate Financial Management (ACF838)

Welcome to the intensive block delivery of Corporate Financial Management at Ulster University. This website contains all materials for the 4-day course structure.

## Course Overview

This module integrates financial management concepts with managerial decision-making, corporate planning, and interaction with the wider business environment. The course is delivered in an intensive 4-day block format, condensing a full semester of content into a comprehensive, focused learning experience.

## Block Delivery Structure

The course is organised into four intensive days:

<div class="day-cards">
  <div class="day-card">
    <h3>Day 1: Financial Framework & Investment Decisions</h3>
    <p><strong>Morning:</strong> Financial framework, business objectives, agency theory, and ratio analysis</p>
    <p><strong>Afternoon:</strong> Capital investment decisions, appraisal techniques, and risk assessment</p>
    <p><a href="days/day1.html" class="btn">View Day 1 Materials</a></p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="day-card">
    <h3>Day 2: Sources of Finance & Cost of Capital</h3>
    <p><strong>Morning:</strong> Long and short-term financing sources, equity and debt characteristics</p>
    <p><strong>Afternoon:</strong> Cost of capital, WACC, and capital structure decisions</p>
    <p><a href="days/day2.html" class="btn">View Day 2 Materials</a></p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="day-card">
    <h3>Day 3: Dividend Policy & Working Capital</h3>
    <p><strong>Morning:</strong> Dividend theories, policy decisions, and practical considerations</p>
    <p><strong>Afternoon:</strong> Working capital management, cash, inventory, and credit management</p>
    <p><a href="days/day3.html" class="btn">View Day 3 Materials</a></p>
  </div>
  
  <div class="day-card">
    <h3>Day 4: Applied Financial Management</h3>
    <p><strong>Morning:</strong> Integrated case studies and financial analysis applications</p>
    <p><strong>Afternoon:</strong> Exam preparation, key concept revision, and practice questions</p>
    <p><a href="days/day4.html" class="btn">View Day 4 Materials</a></p>
  </div>
</div>

## Learning Outcomes

By completing this module, you will be able to:

1. **Demonstrate knowledge and understanding** of investment, financing and dividend decisions
2. **Assess the potential and significance** of various sources of finance available to a business
3. **Critically examine** issues surrounding corporate financing and dividend policy
4. **Recognize concepts and theories** of financial management

## Assessment {.assessment-info}

This module is assessed through **two components**:

- **Coursework (50%)**: Case study analysis due 07 June 2025
- **Examination (50%)**: 3-hour online exam during the exam period (Date TBC)
